concise_definition: adj. 两者都, pron. 两者, adv. 两者都

definitions.explanation_en: Used to refer to two people or things considered together, indicating that each of the two is included.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用于指代两个被共同考虑的人或事物，表示两者都被包括在内。
definitions.example_en: Both of my parents are doctors.

definitions.explanation_en: Used to refer to two people or things previously mentioned or easily identified, meaning 'the two of them' or 'the two of those'.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用于指代前文已提及或容易识别的两个人或事物，意为‘两者’或‘那两个’。
definitions.example_en: I tried both, but I liked the red one better.
definitions.example_cn: 我试了两个，但我更喜欢红色的那个。

definitions.explanation_en: Used to emphasize that two things or actions are true or happen simultaneously.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用于强调两个事物或动作同时成立或发生。
definitions.example_en: She is both intelligent and hardworking.

comparison.analysis: “All”（全部）用于指三个或三个以上的人或事物，强调整体性；而 “both” 仅用于两个，强调两者并列。例如，“All students passed” 指所有学生（三人以上），而 “Both students passed” 仅指两个学生。
“Either”（两者之一）表示在两个选项中任选其一，具有选择性；而 “both” 表示两者都包括，无选择余地。例如，“You can take either book” 意为选一本，而 “You can take both books” 意为两本都可以拿。
“Neither”（两者都不）是否定形式，表示两个都不成立；而 “both” 是肯定形式，表示两个都成立。两者构成对立语义。例如，“Neither answer is correct” 与 “Both answers are correct” 意思完全相反。
